bibl.title: Despatch from Graham C. Campbell to John Davis, April 14, 1884
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
Hon. John Davis Assistant Secretary of State
Sir,
your communication to S. received. The enclosed draft correct. I hasten to comply with your instructions and enclose the voucher for miscellaneous expenses at the Agency.
My health and that of Mrs. Campbell is very much improved <pb facs="20170615_145200" by our sojouen in this recently and we are looking forward to our return in a few months to out station in Africa. Before going however I wish to place before you the political aspect there as it appears to us and received as definite instructions as the case may demand the aggressiveness of the French Govt.to in that part of the world where there is no power to resist and no one to speak for that poor degraded people is something very much to be deflored. Before <pb facs="20170615_145206" having I will also ask the Department for flag staff flag stationery and blank forms.
I am Sir, Your obedient Servant Graham C. Campbell
